CONFESS.Definition: to admit that you have done something wrong or something that you feel guilty or bad about

TURNS OUT.Definition: to happen in a particular way or to have a particular result, especially an unexpected one

BACK STORY.Definition: the things that have happened to someone before you first see or read about that person in a film or story

GUILLOTINE.Definition: a device, invented in France, consisting of a sharp blade in a tall frame, used in the past for killing criminals by cutting off their heads

WAXWORKS.Definition: a wax model of a person

BRAND.Definition: a type of product made by a particular company

MEMOIRS.Definition: a book or other piece of writing based on the writer's personal knowledge of famous people, places, or events

FAR-FETCHED.Definition: very unlikely to be TRUE, and difficult to believe

WAXWORKING.Definition: the process of making a waxwork

FEATURES.Definition: a typical quality or an important part of something

SUBJECT.Definition: the thing that is being discussed, considered, or studied

HOUSEKEEPER.Definition: a person whose job is to organise another person's house and deal with cooking, cleaning, etc.

ANATOMIST.Definition: an expert in anatomy (= the study of the structure of the body and its parts)

SCULPTURE.Definition: the art of forming solid objects that represent a thing, person, idea, etc. out of a material such as wood, clay, metal, or stone, or an object made in this way

EAGER.Definition: wanting very much to do or have something, especially something interesting or enjoyable

PROSPECTS.Definition: the possibility that something good might happen in the future

APPRENTICE.Definition: someone who has agreed to work for a skilled person for a particular period of time and often for low payment, in order to learn that person's skills

ANATOMY.Definition: the scientific study of the body and how its parts are arranged

BOOM.Definition: an increase in something, or a time when something becomes more popular

IN THE FLESH.Definition: in real life, and not on TV, in a film, in a picture, etc.

GET A NAME FOR HERSELF.Definition: became known for a particular thing

MONARCHY.Definition: a country that has a king or queen

SOCIALISING.Definition: to spend time when you are not working with friends or with other people in order to enjoy yourself

MENTOR.Definition: a person who gives a younger or less experienced person help and advice over a period of time, especially at work or school

CELEBRATORY.Definition: celebrating the importance of something or someone

EXECUTED.Definition: to kill someone as a legal punishment

ARISTOCRATS.Definition: people of high social rank who belongs to the aristocracy

MARVEL.Definition: to show or experience great surprise or admiration

FATE.Definition: what happens to a particular person or thing, especially something final or negative, such as death or defeat

REIGN.Definition: to be the main feeling or quality in a situation or person

STEEL.Definition: a strong metal that is a mixture of iron and carbon, used for making things that need a strong structure, especially vehicles and buildings

MASKS.Definition: a covering for all or part of the face that protects, hides, or decorates the person wearing it

GRUESOME.Definition: extremely unpleasant and shocking, and usually dealing with death or injury

DESTINY.Definition: the things that will happen in the future

ILLUSIONIST.Definition: an entertainer who performs tricks where objects seem to appear and then disappear

GORE.Definition: blood that has come from an injury and become thick

PROFITABLE.Definition: making or likely to make a profit, make money

EERILY.Definition: in a strange, frightening, and mysterious way

OUTGROWING.Definition: to grow bigger than or too big for something

TIMELESS.Definition: Something that is timeless does not change as the years go past

LIKENESS.Definition: the fact of being similar in appearance

TAPPED INTO.Definition: to manage to use something in a way that brings good results

INHERENTLY.Definition: in a way that exists as a natural or basic part of something

BANKING ON.Definition: to expect something or depend on something happening

ELABORATED.Definition: containing a lot of careful detail or many detailed parts

GOODIES.Definition: an object that people want or enjoy, often something nice to eat
